result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius L Wooten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: In the Wisconsin State Prison System
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause. No contact with Liza D. nor address.
Cooperate with the Department. Restitution set at zero. Cooperate with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample--pay surcharge over probation. Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid over probation. Any balance to be converted into civil judgment. Upon revocation through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession; Voting.

timeConds.notes: Huber for work and child care conditional upon absolute sobriety. Order-in 3-26-14 10:00 a.m.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demetrius L Wooten

records.addlTxt: Denying Request for Good Time.  kmw
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Glenn H. Yamahiro, Branch 34, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for good time credit.
Also referenced ATN #41004197624052, arrest date 1-4-14, MPD.

Defendant Demetrius L Wooten in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
**********
Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 54 months, with credit for 6 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 30 months; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is  24 months.  This sentence is STAYED and defendant placed on PROBATION for a period of 3 years
Upon revocation, the defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Terms of probation and extended supervision:
-6 months condition time in the House of Correction with Huber for work and child care conditional upon absolute sobriety.  Order in 3/26 10am.
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No contact with Liza D nor address
Cooperate with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department
-Seek and maintain full time employment

Restitution set at zero
The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--pay surcharge over probation; any balance to be converted into civil judgment.  Upon revocation through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
The Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid over probation; any balance to be converted into civil judgment.  Upon revocation through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting

Defendant Demetrius L Wooten in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw

Defendant Demetrius L Wooten in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Paul Hauer for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 1/22/14.
css

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with L.D. OR 1964 S 30TH ST.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION with DRUG TESTING.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Demetrius L Wooten in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Demetrius L Wooten in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
